5/ this is all stuff that builders today are already working on

the first player-focused F2P web3 game that reaches 100M users will be the thing that convinces people web3 games can be positive. not winning reddit debates or twitter beefs. so let's build! ğŸš€

4/ i really think the only long-term solution is to keep building ğŸ§±

ship great games that are fun, have innovative on-chain mechanics, and enable player ownership and trading in a non-predatory way. also lower barriers to entry and make NFTs affordable, etc

3/ most importantly, there just aren't enough good web3 games live yet that players can experience firsthand to see what all the fuss is about. so most information comes secondhand or through polarizing channels like reddit or twitter

2/ a few things:
- NFTs are expensive and still not affordable by the average gamer who saves up and buys one $20-40 game every 3 months
- there are scams and the high $ amounts hurt (vs getting "scammed" in a mobile game just meant wasting $0.99 on a good you didn't use)

1/ it feels like the cultural war against NFTs in games is escalating

i used to think it was similar to the free-to-play backlash a decade ago, but it's worse today and some key differences are likely exacerbating it ğŸ‘‡

4/ Long-term, Carry1st aspires to build the Garena of Africa - combining games, financial services, ecommerce, social, and web3 on/offramps in a convenient super app ğŸ”¥

3/ @Carry1st was founded by Cordel Robbin-Coker, Lucy Hoffman, and Tino M to address these challenges. They've aggregated Africa's disparate payment networks into a modern fintech platform serving over 1M players
2/ Payments is also a major barrier to game developers today - the African landscape is highly fragmented across 270+ wallets, 500+ banks, and multiple card networks in 55 countries ğŸ’³

1/ @Carry1st represents @a16z's first investment into an African-headquartered company!

We see a huge opportunity for a next-gen games platform and social network in Africa. Few games today target Africa and even fewer design or localize for the continent ğŸŒ

Thrilled to share that @dhaber and I are leading the next round in @Carry1st - Africa's leading next-gen game platform building at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3. More ğŸ‘‡

High-level framework for games M&A deals:
- Acquire for IP (MSFT x @bethesda)
- Acquire for team (Tencent x @riotgames)
- Acquire for capabilities (TTWO x @zynga, FB x @oculus)

Mega-acquisitions like Atvi fall into multiple buckets: IP (Blizzard, COD) + capabilities (mobile)

2 record-breaking games M&A deals in just the first month of this year! ğŸ”¥
